channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole - Pickhurst Lane, 22nd January
item.description:
As driving towards Hayes, hole just before entrance into Miller and Carter. Pls repair.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickhurst Lane, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Even more potholes - Still dangerous to decend speedbump going North, 22nd January
item.description:
Even more potholes - Now dangerous to decent speedbump going North Since the initial report by someone else in July this is not only an outstanding problem, but a worsening one. More potholes have developed on the north side and it's making the decent dangerous to car undercarriage even at reasonable speeds. This needs fixing ASAP (Previous report in December - issue worsening and not fixed)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, The Landway, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light not working, 22nd January
item.description:
The street light is not working outside entrance to marvels wood making it extremely dark in this area many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castlecombe Road, Elmstead, Greater London

item.title: Pickhurst Rec - Litter, 22nd January
item.description:
Along the northern edge of Pickhurst Rec, running parallel to Mead Way, build up of litter needs removing. It’s not immediately visible as most of it is caught in perimeter undergrowth, bushes etc. Please can you attend and clear all the litter along this edge. Please start at: ///wiped.lines.myself https://w3w.co/wiped.lines.myself And continue along to: ///shall.advice.likely https://w3w.co/shall.advice.likely Photos show a small selection of the litter. Please ensure this request is only marked as closed once the work has been completed. Issues are regularly closed before action has been taken, which leads to unnecessary re-reporting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mead Way, Hayes, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Canterbury Road NW6, 22nd January
item.description:
Canterbury Road in front of Woodrow House is looking horrendously messy. Haven't been swept for at least half a year. Rubbish is everywhere including inside the plants bay. There are no public general bins been placed along this road. Can we request a few bins here so that people won't littering everywhere and please make sure that there are street sweepers to empty the bins frequently. Big pile of leaves from last autumn is not even been swept as well on Peel Precinct which adjoining Canterbury Road. Will council be planting more flowering trees or plants at the flower bay along this road? It will be nice. Thank you.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Peel Precinct, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Zebra crossing light cover loose, 22nd January
item.description:
The cover on the central zebra crossing light at Brampton Road has yet again moved round, meaning the light is now flashing directly in our bedrooms at night. Can this be rectified again, and make a more permanent fix than previous attempts.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brampton Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big potholes., 22nd January
item.description:
My house is adjacent to multiple potholes. When vans, trucks and buses hit it my house shakes. Every few minutes. This is a repeating problem. Please fix the road properly, instead of ineffective, inefficient, multiple patch up jobs. These must surely cost more than just doing it properly once.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Longland Drive, Woodside Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation from private houses impede pavement access, 22nd January
item.description:
Overhanging vegetation particularly 29 and 31 Garden Road and round the corner into Lawn Close impede pavement access for pedestrians (especially with umbrellas), prams and mobility scooters etc. This has been problem for months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garden Road, Plaistow, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flashing street light, 22nd January
item.description:
This street light located on Maritime street has began rapidly flashing on and off within the last few hours. It is very distracting and has me worried that it could become an even bigger problem if left unresolved. There is also reports from people living in the local area that it is causing headaches for people who work from home.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodland Crescent, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
